verses.text: 耶和華的話臨到亞米太的兒子約拿，說：

words.note: The Hebrew name of God, often translated as 'LORD' in English Bibles.
Often used for God's word, judgment, or blessing 'coming upon' someone.

verses.heading: Jonah Tries to Run from the Lord

verses.text: 「起來！到尼尼微大城去，警告其中的居民，因為他們的惡行已經達到我面前。」

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts to denote an important or large city.
Common in moral or religious discourse, referring to wrongful acts.
Can refer to a physical presence or a divine audience.

verses.text: 可是約拿卻起來，要逃往他施去，躲避耶和華；他下到約帕，找到了一隻要開往他施去的船；他給了錢，就上船（「上船」原文作「下船」），要和他們同往他施去，離開耶和華。

words.note: Indicates a turn or contrast, often with a slight emphasis.
Indicates imminent action or intention.
Often used for vehicles or ships departing to a destination.
Indicates consequence or immediate action.

verses.text: 但是耶和華在海上忽然颳起大風，於是海中狂風大作，船幾乎要破裂了。

words.note: Used as a locative suffix here, meaning 'on the sea'.

words.definition: in the sea, amidst the sea

words.note: An idiom describing a violent or raging storm with strong winds.
Indicates imminent action.

verses.text: 水手都很懼怕，各人向自己的神大聲呼求；他們為了減輕船的重量，就把船上的東西拋在海裡，可是約拿卻下了船艙，躺著熟睡了。

words.note: Often used for pleading or praying for help.

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of

words.note: Indicates consequence or immediate action.
Lit. 'east-west', referring to general items or goods.
Indicates a turn or contrast, often with a slight emphasis.

verses.text: 船長走到他面前，對他說：「你怎麼啦！睡得那麼熟？快起來，求告你的 神吧！或者 神會記念我們，使我們不至於喪命！」

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for praying or calling upon God.
Capitalized '神' refers to the one true God.
Capitalized '神' refers to the one true God.

verses.text: 水手就彼此說：「來吧！讓我們抽籤，好知道這場災禍臨到我們，是因誰的緣故。」於是他們抽籤，結果抽中了約拿。

words.note: Ancient practice of divination or decision-making.

verses.text: 他們就對約拿說：「請告訴我們，這場災禍臨到我們，是因誰的緣故？你是作甚麼的？你從哪裡來？你是哪一國的人？哪一族的人？」
他回答說：「我是希伯來人，我敬畏耶和華天上的 神，就是那創造海洋和陸地的。」

words.note: Often used in a religious context for 'fear of the LORD'.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Capitalized '神' refers to the one true God.

verses.text: 眾人就大大懼怕，對他說：「你為甚麼這樣作呢？（「你為甚麼這樣作呢？」或譯：「你作的是甚麼呢？」）」那些人知道他躲避耶和華，原來約拿告訴了他們。

words.note: Reduplication for emphasis.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.

verses.text: 因為海浪越來越洶湧，他們又對他說：「我們該怎樣處置你，才能叫海浪平靜呢？」

words.note: Indicates a continuous increase in degree.
Here meaning 'to make/let something happen'.

verses.text: 他回答說：「你們把我抬起來，投在海裡，海浪就會平靜，因為我知道，這場大風暴臨到你們，是為了我的緣故。」

words.note: Indicates the object of the verb is placed before the verb.
A directional complement indicating upward movement.
Often used in religious texts for events or judgments befalling people.
Often used in the construction '為...的緣故' (for the sake of...).

verses.text: 那些人雖然破浪掙扎，要把船靠岸，卻是不能，因為海浪不斷洶湧撲來。

words.note: Describes the action of a boat moving forcefully through waves.
Indicates the object of the verb is placed before the verb.
Describes a sudden, forceful movement towards the speaker/object.

verses.text: 他們就呼求耶和華，說：「耶和華啊！我們懇求你，不要因這人叫我們喪命；不要把無辜人的血歸在我們身上，因為你耶和華是照自己所喜悅的行事。」

words.note: Commonly used in religious contexts for prayer or supplication to God.
Used to express exclamation, exhortation, or emphasis.
More formal and earnest than '請' (please).
Here meaning 'to make/let something happen'.
Often used in grave or serious contexts.
Indicates the object of the verb is placed before the verb.
Used to denote placing responsibility or consequence upon someone.
Can refer to literally on the body or figuratively upon a person.
Often seen in more formal or classical Chinese, preceding a verb to form a noun phrase.
More formal or literary than '喜歡' (like).
Refers to the way one behaves or carries out actions.

verses.text: 於是他們把約拿抬起來，投在海裡，怒濤就平息了。

words.note: Indicates the object of the verb is placed before the verb.
A directional complement indicating upward movement.
A more poetic or literary term for very rough waves.
Often used for commotions, conflicts, or natural phenomena calming down.

verses.text: 那些人就大大敬畏耶和華，向他獻祭和許願。

words.note: Reduplication for emphasis.

verses.text: 耶和華卻安排了一條大魚，把約拿吞下。約拿就在魚腹中三日三夜。

words.note: Often used as a locative suffix.
